message.body: Hey Hunter. I hope you're well? Michigan is really awesome. You should try to come to Ox-Bow in the future sometime. I wanted to ask your advise about sh
ipping our the prints to everyone from my kickstarter. So I have about 200 boxes and smaller items to ship to all over the world. Do I have to take them
all down to the post office and ship them individually. I have never used FedEx or UPS. Would it he easier or less expensive to use them. And how do I go
about do that. Thanks. I hope you're well.

You're going to have to check prices for international shipping. DHL may be cheaper than fed ex . I primarily use fed ex. If you get your pieces weighed and measured, you can print labels and have FedEx pick them up or u can drop them off . Since they are light, usps may be cheaper but fed ex is usually the cheapest for big and heavy.
By the way, congrats on the successful fund raiser
I got into Vermont studio again but only got a partial scholarship so I'm not going
Oh. That sucks. The last 2 times I went there I got in on the fellowship the offer for cancer survivors. Yeah as always shit in the art world I'd frustra
ting. You could always start a kickstarter:) But even with the partial grant, the VSC is just way too fucking expensive. Ox-Bow is totally wroth it thoug
h, I think. The fall program is 250 a week. That's because there's no visiting artist durning the fall residency. It's so beautiful here.
Yeah, so that Kickstarter thing. Someone suggested that I try posting some stuff on reddit, and all of a sudden I saw that my views on flickr where incr
easing by the thousands. I couldn't directly make a post advertising my kickstarter, except on one or two reddit pages that no body seemed to look at, bu
t I tried to indicate that it was going in some of my posts. Anyway, then a few people blogged about it and wrote articles, and the rest is history. This
guy in England who produces books and movies contacted me about making a book. And some other dude is friends with Joe Rogan and he's going to see if he
wants to do a podcast with me - which I don't know if that'd even be a good thing, honestly. Another guy is building a website for me. I guess we'll wai
t to see if any of this actually comes to fruition.
Anyway, the shipping stuff still seems pretty complicated to me, so I guess I'll try talking with you more about it a little later, when it actually come
time that I have to start that process. Thanks Hunter. I'll talk with you soon.
